name: places/ChIJ7_hsBO9YwokR04z-hYxHaw8
adrFormatAddress: 1125 5th Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: Dear readers. I used Dr Pfeifer 10 years ago to have a breast revision of someone else’s work. Everything was great. Fast to present date….I went back to her after ten years to have the implants replaced. During pre op it was discussed that she would be using a mesh and possibly two different sized implants like she did ten years ago. Not only was it heavily discussed that the mesh had to be put in but it was on paper too. After this current surgery she did not use a mesh (stated I didn’t need it) and did use the same size implants. During and after healing I noticed a major significant drop in my left breast because there was no support from the mesh (especially after two capsulectomies). My breast were lop sided. For 7 months I have not been able to look in the mirror and I’m severely depressed. I have to get a revision done from another surgeon who stated after a capsulectomy “I always use a mesh”. I tried reaching out to the doctor numerous times regarding this through her staff with no response. I am now forced to take legal action. If I could share my photos to show the damage that was done…I would. I HIGHLY suggest you think 3x before using Dr. Pfeifer so you don’t end up looking like me. DO NOT RECOMMEND!

originalText.text: Kind, caring, knowledgeable, experienced; these are all the things you hope to find in the person that could be potentially operating on your body, and these are exactly the qualities you will find in Dr. Pfeifer. She came highly recommended to me and after a small procedure with her I could see why my  friend insisted I go see her! Dr. Pfeifer is not only very good at what she does (this you can find in other surgeons), but she had the ability to listen and hear my needs as if she were about to operate on one of her own family members. I felt extremely comfortable with her and was very happy with my results. After meeting her I don't think I could ever go to another plastic surgeon again. I advise anyone looking for a consult to book an appointment with Dr. Pfeifer. Trust me, you won't regret it!

originalText.text: Dr. Pfeifer and her team are the best of the best! They are extremely attentive and care about their patients. Dr. Pfeifer is an artist and I couldn’t imagine getting my procedure done anywhere else. Maureen and the NYC team are responsive, knowledgeable, and have/continue to support me through my pre-op and post surgery. Great experience, would highly recommend!

text.text: Dr. Pfeifer and her team are the best of the best! They are extremely attentive and care about their patients. Dr. Pfeifer is an artist and I couldn’t imagine getting my procedure done anywhere else. Maureen and the NYC team are responsive, knowledgeable, and have/continue to support me through my pre-op and post surgery. Great experience, would highly recommend!

originalText.text: Dr. Pfeifer is a smart doctor, who I am sure, is good at what she does. I do not want to discredit her capabilities. However, I could not get past her front desk and billing personnel. Stating that it is all a "hot mess" would be kind. The disorganization is horrendous and scared us away from moving forward to have Dr. Pfeifer cut! Best decision I made since I had the chance to speak to a few other doctors, get a sense of how other offices do, should run and the professionalism. I STRONGLY recommend you do your due diligence when looking for a doctor and look at the ENTIRE office as it a major part of the process throughout your surgery.

originalText.text:
I interviewed many doctors in Manhattan, before stumbling upon Dr. Pfeifer's information. I loved her results on her website, and seeing all the positive reviews on Google, RealSelf, etc, so I went in for my first appointment, and instantly knew she was the right doctor for me.

Like many other reviews mentioned, her staff is INCREDIBLE. Vicky, especially, was so informative, patient, and even gave me her personal cell to reach out if I ever had questions or concerns, which means a lot to a hypochondriac like myself. Dr Pfeifer's bedside manner is also impeccable. She has never made me feel rushed or unimportant, and is super sweet and supportive. I probably asked her a thousand questions, and she thoughtfully answered each one. She didn't pressure me into any decision and informed me about each type of implant, and the risks associated.

My surgery was 6 months ago, and everything seems to be healing wonderfully. I LOVE THE RESULTS!! Like other reviews mentioned, the only thing concerning for me is the quality of the scar. My scars aren't as "discreet" as I initially thought they would be,  but by no means do they look large or scary in any way. I'm also early in my healing process, so I'm waiting another 6 months or so before accurately reviewing the scar healing process.

Overall, Dr. Pfeifer and her staff have left me feeling nothing but comfort and happiness with my results. :D
